jobDescription: Position Summary: Design and execute Luke Waites Center research studies compatible with the center goals, TSRHC and Institutional Review Board guidelines, including preparation and submission of regulatory documents and files to the Institutional Review Board and other appropriate entities. Provide technical support in methodology and statistics for Center research activities. Prepare reports suitable for peer-reviewed journals and professional society meetings. Maintain knowledge of current research in learning disorders (LD) and provide continuing education for Luke Waites Center staff. Present research findings and clinical implications of LD research to a variety of audiences. Participate in the submission of applications for external funding for department research Manage budgets of research studies. Supervise personnel and coordinate scheduling with schools necessary for research activities. Maintain material resources needed for research activities and the collection, storage and retrieval of research records. # # Education/Experience Requirements: Doctorate degree, or near completion of doctoral degree, in related field of research. Experience in childhood learning disorders and/or reading research preferred. Experience working in school-based research is preferred.
